Receive a 6-digit code via SMS. You\nwill receive a call if you do not receive\nthe SMS.

Dashboards will be displayed in lists which show more information in one screen.
Generate a 6-digit code from one of\nyour trusted devices. Trusted devices\nare not required to authenticate.
The system will require authentication\nwhen logging in to the UnionBank\nBusiness Banking.
The system will require authentication\nwhen transacting in the UnionBank\nBusiness Banking.
Take a quick tour to see what you can do\nwith SME Business Banking!
you can quickly select this beneficiary when creating transfers.

By clicking \'Next\' you agree to both the UnionBank\nPrivacy Policy and Terms & Conditions.
UnionBank uses the latest technology to keep all your transactions secure. You can manage your settings to find the perfect balance between security and convenience.
Easily collect payments by sending payment links to your buyers.
Approve or reject business transactions\nanytime, anywhere.
Enjoy real-time and hassle-free fund transfers to both local and international banks.
We\'ll notify you of the status of your buyer\'s payments so you can focus on running the business
Give your buyers multiple ways of paying you with just a single payment link
Facilitate all your business payments with the most extensive list of government and utility billers. And many more!
Enroll all your companies and subsidiaries. Easily switch between them without needing to logout.
Open an account online. You can view the list of required documents on the account opening website. Tap here to get started.
Enroll your account online. The Business Banking enrollment form will be generated for you upon submission. Upload the signed document and get access in 1–2 days. Tap here to get started.
You can view the Privacy Policy and the Terms and Conditions here.
You can view the key features of the app here.
Tap here to apply for a UnionBank Business account. This will redirect you to the Business Banking website. It is advisable to view it from your desktop browser.
Tap here to continue your UnionBank Business account application. You can also check the status of your existing application. You will be asked for a reference number.
Your business will need an enrolled UnionBank Account to use Business Banking. If you don`t have one, please contact UnionBank Corporate Customer Care and we’ll get you started.
You can reach UnionBank Business Support through business@unionbankph.com or (02) 8\–667–2668.
View the FAQs and Terms & Conditions
Choose how to view your accounts list
Coming from the old ebanking website?\nYou can migrate your user credentials here.
Already a Business Banking user?\nYou can login here.
Welcome to The Portal.\nEnter your old Corporate eBanking credentials to begin the migration process.
Welcome to SME Business Banking.\nEnter your old Corporate eBanking credentials to begin the migration process.
Welcome to The Portal.\nEnter your old OneHub credentials to begin.
Welcome to SME Business Banking.\nEnter your old OneHub credentials to begin.
I am coming from the old ebanking website.
I am coming from the ecrediting hub.
Thank you for moving over to The Portal.\n\nBefore we continue, we need to update a few of your login credentials.

The Portal uses your email address as your user ID. Remember that this email must be unique and cannot be shared with other users.\n\nIf you already have a The Portal account, enter your existing email address to merge this user into your account.
Otherwise, nominate a different email address.

Trusted devices are not required to
go through OTP verification when
logging in or transacting.

Trusted devices can also generate
OTP for other devices.

Forgetting this device will log you out
and remove your UnionBank Business
Banking profile from this device.

You will also stop receiving push
notifications on this device.
We have updated our terms and conditions. Click \"Continue\" to see what\'s new!
We are unable to generate a verification from this device. Kindly set your device\'s Date & Time settings to Automatic.
You can manage your devices by going to your Settings > Security > Manage Devices.
SCAN ME!\nView this transaction\non your mobile app!
Service permission required for this feature.
Are you sure you want to mark all alerts as read?
Before we proceed, here are some reminders when depositing a check:
Remote Check Deposit is currently limited to UnionBank checks only.
Successfully deposited checks will be cleared within 2 hours.
If you need to deposit other bank’s checks, you may visit any one of our branches.
Checks must be paid to the order of your company\'s name
The check amount should be below PHP 500,000.00
The date on the check must not be older than 6 months.
Make sure to write the following details at the back of the check:

\u2022 Write \"UnionBank of the Philippines\".
\u2022 Write the Date of Deposit.
\u2022 Write your company\'s UnionBank Account Number.
\u2022 Your Signature.
There should be no erasures, alterations nor deficiencies on the front and back side of the check
Make sure to get a clear, well-lit photo that captures the entire check, front and back
After your deposit is cleared, please keep your physical check for 6 months.

For other bank\'s checks, transactions before the clearing cut-off time will be cleared the following banking day. Transactions after the clearing cut-off time or during weekends and holidays will be cleared within two banking days.
Ensure that the check details being captured are aligned to this instruction
Seamlessly deposit checks to your account. All you need is your check and your phone\'s camera.
Before you get started, here are a few tips to help you.
This is where you will find the account number and the check number. You will need these values to complete the check deposit.

1. Write "Unionbank of the Philippines".
2. Write the Date of Deposit.
3. Write your Unionbank Account Number.
4. Your Signature.​
Open a UnionBank account in as fast as two days! Just go through the online wizard and fill-out your company details.
Please enter your Digital Account Opening Reference Number of the Registered Contact Person.
Click here if you want to edit an existing application
See the full list of requirements here.
Prepare a valid ID for scanning and verification.

\u2022 Passport
\u2022 Driver’s License
\u2022 SSS ID

\u2022 PRC ID
\u2022 Postal ID
\u2022 UMID
Ensure that the details you will provide matches the details written on your ID.
Prepare the following business registration documents for scanning and verification.

\u2022 Application for Trade Name
\u2022 Certified True Copy of the Certificate of Registration of Trade Name with DTI.
\u2022 Mayor’s Permit
We will be validating your identity through a selfie. We advise you to have sufficient lighting during this step.
It is recommended that you finish the application once started however, you may exit any time and continue later.

For other Business Types not indicated, please reach out
to Union Corporate Customer Care (Union3C) at
union3c@unionbankph.com
UnionBank checking account that comes with a free initial checkbook.
UnionBank checking account that comes with a business check software and free initial checkbook.
By clicking next, you agree to fund the account within 30 days from account opening. Failure to do so will result in account closure.

Send funds to other UnionBank accounts or to other banks locally or Internationally. Please note there will be a fee for every transaction.
Make payments to government agencies, utilities, and various other billers.
An offline check printing application that allows you to print checks on your own.

We detected that this phone is using a different time zone. Please take note that this app follows the Philippine Standard Time (GMT+8:00)
The first and only corporate \n mobile banking app in the Philippines!

Have a task that needs your attention 
 but you’re out of the office or on the road? 
 
 No worries! 
 
 You can view and work on all 
 of your pending AND finished tasks!

Never fear! 
 
 UnionBank uses the most up-to-date 
 technology (multi-factor authentication) 
 to make sure that all of your 
 transactions are secured!

We mean it! 
 
 View all of your organization’s transactions, 
 or already completed. It’s like having 
 your work station in your pocket!

Tap here to view more details about the transaction.
Tap here to view all payments created by your organization.
You can view your account details and recent transactions here.
The Accounts Dashboard allows you to view all your account balances and keep track of all transaction histories.
This displays all your account\'s details.
Tap here to view all previous transactions.
Tap here to view all your organizations and switch between them.
Switch between transactions:\n1) Pending for your approval\n2) Previously approved/rejected.

Tap here to:
1) Add beneficiaries
2) Manage transfers
3) Schedule a transfer
Tap here to:\n1) Add frequent billers\n2) Make a payment
Tap here to view transfers based on their current status.
Tap here to view payments based on their current status.
Tap here to view and create transactions.
View transaction pending for your approval here.
Tap to view approval and transaction details.
Hold to select multiple transactions for approval.
You can view the approval hierarchy for the transaction here.
Tap on the boxes to display members of the approval group.
View your current role and change your active organization.
You can transfer funds to another UnionBank Account.
Or you can transfer to other banks using instaPay, PESONet, PDDTS, or SWIFT.
Tap to select a source account for the transaction. You\'ll need to select one before filling-out other fields.
Type in the details of your beneficiary here.
Enter the account number or choose from your own list of pre-enrolled beneficiaries.
Indicate one of your accounts to be deposited to.
You can leave the amount blank and let the payor input the amount upon scanning of the QR code.
Select from the list of billers. Additional fields will show up depending on the biller requirements.
Type in additional details for the payment here.
Enter the amount to be paid here.
You can also schedule your fund transfers immediately or ahead of time. You can also set the frequency (weekly, monthly, etc.) for repeating transfers
You can also schedule your bills payment immediately or ahead of time. You can also set the frequency (weekly, monthly, etc.) for repeating payments
You can still make changes by tapping here.
Once you have entered and reviewed all details, you can tap here to proceed to the confirmation page.
Tap here to go back to the list of transfers.
Tap here when you\'re done to proceed to the confirmation page.
Tap here to go back to the list of payments.
Or tap here to create another one.
Tap here to select from a list of purposes.
Type in the account number or choose from your own list of pre-enrolled beneficiaries.
Tap here to select from a list of banks.
Remarks are optional but you can enter any specifics. (ex: Payment to Supplier)
Remarks are optional but you can enter any specifics. (ex: Water Bill for March)
If you manage multiple organizations, you can tap here to switch from one to the other, without having to logout!
Revisit the tutorials by tapping the help button up here.
We\'re excited to show you our brand new business banking mobile app. Get ready to experience banking on-the-go with SME Business Banking.
We\'re excited to show you our brand new corporate mobile app. Get ready to experience banking on-the-go with The Portal.
Don\'t forget to logout when you\'re done.
You can tap here to mark all as read.
This page allows you to make payments or create fund transfers.
The Approval Dashboard allows you to view all pending funds transfers and payments requiring your approval.
Here you can view and edit your profile, turn on or off your notification and security settings, and update your login details.
The alerts dashboard allows you to view all transaction notifications and system announcements. Tap on one to view more details.
Here you can view and edit your profile, turn on or off your notification and security settings, and update your login details.
The fund transfer dashboard allows you to make transfers to other UnionBank accounts and to other banks anywhere in the world.
The generated QR code can be scanned by any UnionBank mobile app or any other instapay QR code-compatible applications.
The bills payment dashboard allows you to make payments to government, water, electricity, telco, and other billers.
Here you can make transfers to other UnionBank accounts or to other banks anywhere in the world.
While here you can make payments to government and utility billers.
Here you can capture check images and deposit them without going to a branch.
Generate a QR code that can be used to send transfers into your account.
Here you can request for payment or check your payment links.
Tap here to enable or disable fingerprint authentication.
Tap here to reset and view all tutorial again.
Customize which notifications you want to receive here.
You can update your mobile number and email address here.
Tap here for the customer support hotline and other frequently asked questions.
Turn your One Time Password (OTP) on or off here.
Turn your One Time Password (OTP) on or off here.
Turn your Fingerprint on here so you won\'t have to type your password every time you login.
All beneficiaries you\'ve enrolled will show up here. Tap here to see more details about each beneficiary.
Make fund transfers hassle-free by enrolling your beneficiaries and suppliers here so you don\'t have to re-enter their details every time you make a transaction!
Tap here to enroll a new beneficiary.
Type details here to search for a beneficiary.
Select which source accounts can be used every time you transfer to this beneficiary.
The beneficiary code is a short code you designate for each beneficiary. Each one must be unique.
Input the beneficiary\'s full name here.
Input the beneficiary\'s account number of the beneficiary here.
Beneficiary address is required for SWIFT payments.
Tap here to select from a list of banks.
Don\'t forget to tap save when you\'re done.
Tap here to select a source account for the transaction. You\'ll need to select a source account before you can fillout other fields.
Biller Alias is a short code you designate for each biller. Each one must be unique.
Tap here to select from a list of billers.
Each biller requires different information. Don\'t forget to fill everything out.
Type details here to search for a frequent biller.
All scheduled and repeating payments you\'ve created will show up here.
Tap to see more details about the transaction.
Hold to select multiple transactions you want to delete.
Make bills payment hassle free by enrolling frequent billers here so you don\'t have to re-enter their details everytime you make a transaction!
Tap here to enroll a frequent biller.
All billers you\'ve enrolled will show up here. Tap to see more details about each biller.
Are you sure you want to skip the tutorial? You can turn this back on again in the settings.
Go to settings and enable permissions
You can repeat a transaction by choosing a frequency (ex: Weekly, Monthly, etc) so you do not have to keep making a transaction every time.
Please review your transaction details below before clicking submit.
Your transaction falls under %1$s approval hierarchy and will only be posted after it has been fully approved.
Some of your transactions were released to the beneficiary bank. Please view the details to see the status breakdown of individual transactions. %1$s serves as your UnionBank reference number.

Some of your transactions were successfully credited to the beneficiary. Please view the details to see the status breakdown of individual transactions. %1$s serves as your UnionBank reference number.
%1$s serves as your reference number. This is a unique value for a given day, which you can use to identify your UnionBank transfers.
Your transaction has been successfully credited to the beneficiary. %1$s serves as your UnionBank reference number.
The reason for the error is %1$s. Please contact your immediate supervisor or your systems manager.
The reason your transfer failed is %1$s
Your transaction will no longer be posted.
Your transaction was not fully approved prior to the transaction date and will no longer be posted.
Please note that checks submitted after the clearing cut-off time or during weekends and holidays will be reviewed the next banking day.
Your check has been sent for clearing. Go to your statement of account to view the status of your check deposit.
We could not proceed with your deposit of Check Number %1$s due to reason: \"%2$s\". Please ensure that the check details entered match the physical check submitted.
Your transaction is ready for release. You will see receive another notifications once the transaction is completed.
Your transaction status could not be identified at the moment. Please check your transaction list later.
rejection from the beneficiary bank. Please double check your transaction details and try again. If you issue persists, please contact the beneficiary bank.
Bancnet system error. Please try again in a few minutes. If the issue persists, please contact Union3C.
You will receive a reference number once your transfer has been successfully posted.
You may check back later or you may call the beneficiary bank for the final status of the transfer.
We have received your transaction details. You may check back later or you may call the beneficiary bank for the final status of the transaction.
Please check with the beneficiary bank for the final status of the transactions.
You will be updated of the final status in a few minutes.

You can leave the amount blank and let the payor input the amount upon scanning of the QR code.
The beneficiary code is used when creating transactions via an upload file. You can use any alphanumeric code (i.e., employee ID, vendor code, etc.) or you can just leave it blank.
Please prepare the necessary SEC or DTI business registration documents.
The business is owned by one (1) person wherein the business identity is not separate and distinct from its owner.
An organization formed by two (2) or more partners, recognized by law wherein its identity is separate and distinct from those of its partners.
An organization formed by at least five (5), but not more than 15 people, and managed by a Board of Directors. Its identity is separate and dsitinct from those of its partners.
An organization formed by at least fifteen (15) members with a common bond of interest. Its identity is separate and distinct from those of its partners.
A non-profit, voluntary citizen`s group funded either by membership dues, private donations, sale of goods and servicces, or grants.

This Payment Gateway Services Agreement (the “Agreement”) is a legally binding contract between you (“Merchant”) and UnionBank of the Philippines (the “Bank”). The Agreement sets out the terms and conditions under which Merchant may utilize UnionBank Payment Gateway Services. Merchant should read this Agreement carefully. \n\nBy clicking on the “I AGREE” button or by using or accessing UnionBank Payment Gateway Services through any means permissible including, without limitation via a web or a mobile application, Merchant acknowledges and agrees that: (i) it has reviewed and understands the Agreement; (ii) it agrees to be legally bound by the terms and conditions of the Agreement and to any of its future amendments or revisions; and (iii) its use of UnionBank Payment Gateway Services and any related products or services will be governed by this Agreement.
“Cardholder” means the person whose name is embossed or printed on the card.
“Cards” means all products authorized and bearing the mark of VISA, or Mastercard. Additional brands may be included by mutual agreement of the Parties.

“Chargeback” means the process by which the Bank will charge to Merchant the amount of transactions which have been paid by the Bank under such circumstances as described in the provisions below or under dispute by the Customer.

“Confidential Information” means any information or material marked “Confidential”, “Restricted” or with such other restrictive legend; proprietary Software including source code and documentation; or any other form of information disclosed which may be reasonably construed to be confidential which either party may disclose to the other under this Agreement. The term Confidential Information shall also include all customer/client information of the Bank, including credit card / charge card code numbers of customers or clients, as well as all personal information of customers or clients, which Merchant may have access to as a consequence of implementation of this Agreement.
“Customer” or “Payor” refers to any person, natural or juridical, that pays the Merchant through Unionbank Payment Gateway Service.
“Documentation” means any online or printed manual or other associated instruction material provided by the Bank in connection with Software and the Services.
“GCash” means the mobile wallet system service of Globe Telecoms.
“Merchant” refers to the Registered Merchant and Unregistered Merchant authorized by the Bank to use the Services.
“Partner Channels” pertain to the provider of the payment options that is available in the market.

“Unionbank Payment Gateway Service” means the payment gateway owned and developed by the Bank that facilitates the transfer of information between a payment portal and the front-end processor or acquiring bank for purpose of authorizing payments.
“Registered Merchant” means a business establishment duly registered with Department of Trade and Industry (DTI), Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and other government regulatory bodies.

“Software” refers all or any portion of the binary computer software programs (including corresponding source code embodied in) relating to the Collections Portal whether in machine readable or printed form and includes all copies, corrections or updates made thereto.

“Service” refers to the Bank’s provision of the UnionBank Payment Gateway Service that allows Merchant’s Customers to pay for goods and/or services through the Bank’s available channels set forth in Sec. B(2).
“Unregistered Merchant” refers to individuals who sell goods or services online who are not required by the law to be registered with DTI, SEC and other government regulatory bodies.

Merchant shall open and maintain an account with the Bank to avail the Service (the “Nominated Settlement Account”). All payments to the Merchant, subject to any allowable deductions as agreed to by the Parties, shall be credited to Merchant’s Nominated Settlement Account in accordance with Clause F.

Card transactions are available only to Registered Merchants. All Card transactions shall require prior approval which will be electronically processed through the UnionBank Payment Gateway, in accordance with the Bank’s standard procedures. Transaction approval shall only refer to the verification of the Card’s validity and expiry date and availability of the credit limit at the time of the transaction.

Merchant acknowledges that a transaction approval does not warrant the authenticity of the transaction or the identity of the Cardholder or Customer, the confirmation of which shall be the sole responsibility and accountability of the Merchant.
All payment-related transactions are subject to this Agreement and to the applicable Terms & Conditions of the Partner Channels, VISA, or Mastercard and other banks.

The Request Payment Feature allows the Merchant to generate a unique checkout page with corresponding expiry duration which can be as short as six (6) hours or as long as seven (7) days. Merchant shall copy and share the page only to the intended Customer. The checkout page may only be used once and may be cancelled by the Merchant anytime as long as it has not been paid. The checkout page can be accessed by the Customers/Payors using any browser on a desktop or mobile device. Payments received through the checkout page will be credited to the Merchant’s Nominated Settlement Account at the specified settlement date in accordance with Schedule A or as defined by the Bank.

Merchant shall only share the checkout page to its intended Customer. In case the page is shared to an unintended recipient, the Merchant shall communicate the error or archive the specific checkout page to avoid future errors.
Merchant shall communicate with Customer the checkout page’ expiration and other information related to the transaction.
Merchant shall provide proper resolution to resolve the issues encountered by the Customer.

Merchant shall hold the Bank free and harmless from any injury or damage arising from or related to Merchant’s used of Request Payment Feature including but not limited to sharing of checkout page to unintended recipient.

Merchant shall assume sole responsibility for the development, publishing, and use of its own e-commerce website and social media accounts including but not limited to Facebook and Instagram (the “Merchant Website”). Merchant shall ensure that Merchant Website contains all the information required by law and the Bank. If appliable, Merchant Website shall be secure and must contain and clearly state, for the Customer’s information, at a minimum, the following:
Complete description of goods and services;
Address of Merchant where it is officially registered and located;
Description of security and data controls;
Such other information as may be required by the Bank.

The Bank retains the right to conduct random checks of the Merchant’s Website and/or offices to determine compliance with this Agreement. The Merchant shall further permit the Bank and its authorized representatives to carry out physical inspections of the Merchant’s place of business and any warehousing facility of the Merchant, if applicable.
In using the Service, the Merchant agrees:

Not to use the Service in any manner, or in furtherance of any activity, which constitutes a violation of any applicable law, regulation or which may result in fraud on any person or which may cause the Bank to be subject to investigation, prosecution, or legal action;

To use information regarding a Cardholder/Customer conveyed to Merchant only for the purpose of completing transactions for which it was intended, and not to sell or otherwise furnish such information to others unless the Merchant has an independent source of such information or obtains the express written consent of such Cardholder/Customer;

To use the Software in accordance with the terms on which the Software has been provided to the Merchant and not to attempt to modify, translate, disassemble, decompile, or reverse engineer the Software; and
That the Merchant Website shall at all times comply with applicable law, rules, and regulations relevant to the use of the Service.

Support. Merchant shall provide a commercially reasonable level of support to the Customer with respect to the transaction and sales made on Merchant’s Website. Such support shall include notice to Customer of (i) a means of contacting Merchant; (ii) procedures for resolving disputes. If the Bank determines in good faith that Merchant is unable to provide a commercially reasonable level of support to the Cardholder, the Bank may suspend or terminate this Agreement.
Registered Merchant’s Website shall at all times comply with the eCommerce authentication protocols and payment card operating procedure as mandated by the payment card brands.

Merchant unconditionally agrees to maintain compliance with the foregoing authentication protocols, as well as other security and data protection standards imposed by the Bank, PCI DSS, and the BSP, from time to time.
The Merchant warrants that it shall not sell or offer to sell, or otherwise facilitate the transfer, of the following:
Pyramid schemes or multi-level marketing structures;
Goods and services prohibited by applicable law, rules, and regulations;
Other goods and services deemed prohibited by the Bank.

Merchant’s non-compliance with its obligations under this Clause E shall be deemed either a wilfull act, omission or negligence, as the case may be, by the Merchant. In case of non-compliance of any provision of this Clause E, the Bank is authorized by the Merchant to impose and collect a penalty equivalent to the amount of (a) the penalty imposed by the Card brands (if applicable) and (b) the transaction involved plus actual of the amounts of the transaction. Said penalties may automatically be deducted by the Bank from the Nominated Settlement Account or collected by other means provided in this Agreement or by law.
The Bank shall have the duty to credit Customers payments into the Merchant’s Nominated Settlement Account subject to the following conditions:
The Bank’s actual receipt of the funds from the Customer;
The amount to be credited shall be subject to deductions as agreed upon by the Parties;
For the use of facilities which require enrollment, such as the Bank\'s or a Partner Channel\'s mobile, online or other facility, the Customer is enrolled in the said facility;
The submission by the Customer of all required information to the Bank or the Bank\'s Partner Channel in the form required by the Bank or Partner-Channel, as the case may be;

Where applicable, Registered Merchant shall: (i) honor without discrimination, all valid and unexpired Cards and/or accounts used by bona fide Card/Accountholders in the purchase of goods and/or services via the internet; (ii) honor Cards in the purchase of goods/services under the Bank\'s credit card installment plan, if any; (iii) participate in loyalty or promotional programs, which may be developed and implemented by the Bank for its Cards. Unless otherwise instructed by the Bank, there should be no minimum or maximum amount requirement for every card transaction.

Bank shall pay Merchant the amount representing all transactions validly generated in connection with sales transactions made at the rate indicated in Schedule A, computed from the face value of the transaction, and in accordance with this Agreement.

In order to facilitate the transfer of payments or debits between the Parties, Merchant may request Bank to (i) deposit the full amount of the Net Deposit of Merchant to the Nominated Settlement Account of the Merchant with the Bank, or (ii) issue check payments representing the Net Deposit of Merchant. Net Deposit of Merchant shall refer to the amount which is required to be paid to Merchant by the Bank which is equivalent to the Grand Total Sales less: (i) credit/refunds or discounts granted to Cardholders by Merchant, if any, (ii) the discount due to the Bank equivalent to a percentage of Grand Total Sales, (iii) applicable taxes, (iv) Chargebacks, (v) adjustments or reversals by the Bank, and (vi) penalties or unpaid amounts by Merchant to the Bank.

Bank shall withhold such withholding tax as may be imposed by the law and the Bureau of Internal Revenue, from the total reimbursements of the Merchant. If applicable, a creditable withholding tax certificate will be issued by the Bank to the Merchant on a regular basis.

In case of closure of the Merchants Nominated Settlement Account for any reason, the total sales amount shall be settled via Union Bank Manager\'s Check in favor of the Client, or by any other means mutually agreed upon by the Parties.
Merchant shall indemnify and hold the Bank free and harmless from any and all claims, expenses, fines, and liability incurred arising out of:
A Chargeback, Refund, over-payment, or other invalidated payments caused by Merchant;
Any error, negligence, misconduct, or fraud by Merchant, its employees or agents; and
Any losses resulting from Merchant’s failure to comply with this Agreement.

The Bank shall refer all disputed transactions to the Merchant. The Merchant undertakes to resolve the dispute within five (5) banking days from receipt of the notice from the Bank or receipt of the Cardholder/Customer’s dispute or request for a chargeback, as the case may be (the “Resolution Period”).

Merchant shall furnish the Bank copies of its communications with the Cardholder/Customer and such necessary documents to enable the Bank to properly document its case file on the Cardholder/Customer. Merchant is required to keep said records for a period of at least three (3) years from the transaction date. Failure of Merchant to comply with its obligation under this provision may result in chargeback.

The Bank shall entertain complaints received related to Card transactions provided that such complaints were received within one hundred eighty (180) calendar days from the transaction date. The Bank reserves the right to change this period at its sole discretion.

For payments made using Non-Card methods, disputes should be resolved entirely and exclusively between Customer and Merchant. The Bank has no obligation to cover the losses of Customer or Payor due to fraud, scam or other bogus transactions. The Bank may, in its sole discretion, suspend or terminate this Agreement with the Merchant due to Merchant’s suspected involvement in fraudulent, scam or bogus transactions.
The Bank has the right to Chargeback the total face amount of the transaction which has already been paid for by the Bank in any of the following instances:
In case of Merchant’s failure to comply with any of its obligations, representation and warranties under this Agreement;
In case of any dispute with respect to the sales transaction which is not resolved within the Resolution Period;
In case the Merchant refuses to pay an outstanding obligation to the Bank such as, but not limited to, obligation arising from imposition of penalties; or
In case of Merchant’s failure to submit transaction slips and/or reports when required by the Bank.
The Bank shall issue the corresponding Chargeback advice to the Merchant, and Bank shall charge the same against the Nominated Settlement Account as provided in the next preceding paragraph.

Upon issuance of the Chargeback advice, Bank will deduct the Chargeback amount from the Net Deposit of the Merchant. If there is no Net Deposit due to Merchant, Merchant irrevocably authorizes the Bank to deduct/offset the Chargeback amount due without need of demand or notice or any further act or deed, against the Nominated Settlement Account, if any, or any account, money, securities, and properties which are now or may hereafter be in the possession of the Bank or any of its subsidiaries, or affiliates. This is without prejudice to the Bank’s right to pursue collection of the Chargeback amount from Merchant through other legal means.
The provisions on Chargeback shall survive the termination of this Agreement

Upon the execution of this Agreement, the Bank may, at its sole discretion and determination, require the Merchant to establish its Nominated Settlement Account as its Hold-Out Deposit Account to secure the performance of Merchant’s obligations under this Agreement. A Hold-out Deposit Account may be funded through any or all of the following:
direct payment by Merchant by depositing funds in the Hold-out Deposit Account at the request of the Bank;
the proceeds of transactions presented hereunder; or

the transfer by the Bank into the Hold-out Deposit of funds withdrawn from the Merchant’s Account(s) or any other accounts, including certificates of deposit, maintained by Merchant or Merchant’s guarantor, if any, with any designated depositary or other financial institution.
The Bank may, in its sole discretion, determine the amount of the Hold-Out Deposit as it may deem proper, subject to the Bank’s internal policies.

Merchant hereby irrevocably authorizes the Bank to make such withdrawals from its Hold out Deposit Account at such times and in such amounts as it may deem necessary hereunder. For this purpose, Merchant shall, upon execution of this Agreement, execute a Deed of Assignment in favor of the Bank, in order to convey its rights, titles, and interest in the Hold-Out Deposit Account.

Merchant hereby agrees that the Bank shall deduct from the Hold-out Deposit Account any amount owed to it in accordance with this Agreement. Any funds in a Hold-out Deposit Account may be held until the expiration of any potentially applicable chargeback rights in respect of Card Transactions submitted hereunder as provided for under the rules and regulations of the Card Associations, which holding period may extend beyond termination of this Agreement. Merchant will not receive any interest on funds being held in the Hold-out Deposit Account.

Merchant shall, upon termination of this Agreement, maintain the sum of at least twenty percent (20%) of its gross sales for the 180-day period prior to termination to be held in Hold-out Deposit Account in accordance with the terms of this Agreement; provided, the Bank may, in its sole discretion, require the Merchant to maintain more than twenty percent (20%) of its gross sales for the 180-day period in the Hold-Out Deposit Account prior to the termination of the Agreement.
Failure by Merchant to fund the Hold-Out Deposit Account within thirty (30) banking days from notice shall be a ground for the Bank to terminate this Agreement.

Should the Hold-out Deposit Account be insufficient to cover the entire amount the Merchant owes the Bank, the Merchant agrees that it shall immediately submit to the Bank, upon written notice of such insufficiency, sufficient collateral over such properties acceptable to the Bank and in such form and substance as may be acceptable to the Bank, as security for the prompt and full compliance by Merchant of its obligations under this Agreement or any other

agreements/documents executed in relation hereto, in the event, without limitation, that the Bank, in its sole determination, finds that (a) there is significant volume of Chargeback; (b) there is an increase in Merchant’s monthly volume of transactions; © additional products/services old/offered by Merchant; and (d) it is necessary to secure the compliance by third party service provider of Merchant with the Bank’s requirements (at the Bank’s sole judgment); or (e) it is necessary for the protection of the Bank’s rights and interests under this Agreement or under other agreement/document related hereto.

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of two (2) years and will automatically renew for a period of one (1) year, unless otherwise terminated pursuant to the provisions of this Agreement.
This Agreement may be terminated forthwith by the Bank upon written notice in the event of

with immediate effect, once the other Party ceases to conduct business, becomes or is declared insolvent or bankrupt, makes an assignment for the benefit of its creditors, becomes the subject of any judicial or administrative order relating to its insolvency, liquidation, bankruptcy or protection of creditors\' rights or appointment of a receiver, judicial manager or any similar officer relating to its insolvency, liquidation, bankruptcy or protection of creditors’ rights; or
with immediate effect, once Merchant enters into a merger, consolidation with another entity and Merchant is not the surviving entity.

Bank may suspend and/or terminate this Agreement with immediate effect, without need for prior notice to Merchant if there exists reasonable grounds to do so which warrants the immediate suspension and/or termination of the Agreement such as, but not limited to:
Non-compliance with Card brand rules, PCI-DSS rules, and Bank rules;
Breach of this Agreement by Merchant;
Termination of the Bank’s agreement/s with the Card brands; or
Upon lawful orders of pertinent government authorities.

In addition to the foregoing, the Bank may terminate this Agreement for any cause without penalty, by giving the other Party at least thirty (30) days’ written notice prior to the intended date of termination.
the Parties agree upon written request to immediately return all Proprietary Work, Confidential Information and all copies thereof belonging to the other party, within its possession or control; and
all obligations incurred or existing against the Merchant, and all rights vested or accrued under this Agreement, shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

The Parties understand and agree that all intellectual property rights in, arising out of or pertaining to the Software and the provision of the UnionBank Payment Gateway Service shall remain vested in the Bank and/or its licensors.
In the event that the Software or the Service are held to be infringing, Bank’s only obligation shall be limited to any of the following, at the Bank’s sole discretion:
Modify the Software or the Service to render the same non-infringing;
Procure for the Merchant, at commercially reasonable terms, the right to continue using the Software or the Service; or

Replace the Software or Service or infringing part thereof with alternative, substantially equivalent, non-infringing programs, materials, and supporting documentation so that the same becomes non-infringing.

Prevention of Infringement. If for any reason the Service or any component of the same becomes, or in the Bank’s opinion is likely to become, the subject of a claim for infringement, the Bank reserves the right, at its option and expense, either (i) to revoke the right of the Merchant to continue using the Service; or (ii) to replace or modify the Service or the infringing component of the same so that it becomes non-infringing.
Unless otherwise expressly provided herein, no rights in and to either Party’s industrial or intellectual property is conveyed hereunder.

Any use by either Party of the other Party’s business name, trade name, trademarks, service marks or other proprietary marks within any press release, advertisement, marketing material or other form of public announcement shall be in accordance with that other Party’s guidelines for the use of the same and in any event shall not be without the prior consultation and written consent of that other Party.
Where applicable, Merchant shall appoint a representative/project coordinator with the authority to represent Merchant in all matters relating to marketing and service delivery of the Service.
The Bank shall appoint a Bank representative with the authority to represent the Bank in all matters relating to promotion and service delivery of the Service.
The Parties shall convene meetings at regular intervals, as agreed, to review the promotion and service delivery of the Service, if the Bank deems necessary.
Merchant understands and agrees that Bank is required to report the business name of the Merchant and names and identification details of the latter’s principal to a file maintained by the brands;
Merchant waives and will hold the Bank free and harmless from claims that Merchant may have as a result of such reporting.

Parties agree that Confidential Information exchanged shall be kept confidential and shall not be disclosed or given to any third party during and after the expiry or termination of this Agreement without the prior written consent of the disclosing party. The aforementioned undertaking does not apply to information:
already known or independently obtained by the receiving party;
publicly known or becomes publicly known through no breach of this Agreement; or

required to be disclosed pursuant to a lawful order of a court or government agency, provided the receiving party provides the other party with written notice of such order prior to disclosure and within such time as to allow the other party reasonable opportunity to oppose such disclosure before a court or agency of competent jurisdiction.
Merchant hereby also agrees to maintain the privacy of all Merchants and details of Customers in performance of its obligations hereunder in accordance with prevailing laws.

The Parties shall use or permit to use Confidential Information solely in connection with the Service and not for its own or any third-party benefit provided that the Parties shall be entitled to disclose Confidential Information to those of its employees and contractors, if any, to whom and to the extent such disclosure is reasonably necessary for the purposes of this Agreement. The responsibility of such disclosures and the liability of making such disclosures shall be exclusively on the party making such disclosures.
The obligation to protect Confidential Information under this clause shall survive any expiry or termination of this Agreement.

Both Parties warrant and agree that it shall ensure the protection of the data privacy rights of the Customers, or individuals whose personal, sensitive personal, or privileged information is controlled by or processed by Merchant on its own or through its representatives, in the implementation of this Agreement. Pursuant thereto, both Parties agree to comply with the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and all applicable and relevant laws, their respective implementing rules and regulations and data privacy protection rules and policies being implemented or to be implemented by the National Privacy Commission. In line therewith, each Party warrants and represents that it has in place and is implementing all the organizational, physical and technical security measures for the protection of Personal Information and/or Sensitive Personal
Information required under the Data Privacy Act, and any additional or specific measures required by the data privacy protection rules and policies being implemented or to be implemented;

Both Parties shall take all the steps necessary to ensure that any person acting under its authority and who has access to Personal Information and/or Sensitive Personal Information of Customers processed, does not process them except upon Merchant’s instructions, or in accordance with applicable law. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, the Bank shall be the Personal Information Processor as defined under the Data Privacy Act of 2012;

Each Party shall defend, indemnify, and hold the other Party, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, stockholders, employees, and agents harmless from and against any and all claims, suits, causes of action, liability, loss, costs, and damages, including attorney’s fees and costs of litigation, in connection with or as a result of any third party claim arising from the personal data breach of any Party directly attributable from acts or omissions resulting in the violation of the Data Privacy Act;

Each Party shall at all times be responsible for ensuring that the Personal Information and/or Sensitive Personal Information, in whatever form, is stored securely and hereby agrees to implement security measures to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the Personal Information and/or Sensitive Personal Information; and protect it from accidental or unlawful destruction, alteration and unauthorized disclosure, unlawful processing or use, fraudulent misuse, or loss or destruction while in the Party’s custody; and

In case of any judicial order, governmental action, or legal obligation requiring any Party to disclose Personal Information and/or Sensitive Personal Information of Customer, the Party shall immediately inform the other. Each Party shall support and cooperate in the intervention of the Party in addressing the judicial order, governmental action, or legal obligation, or minimizing the scope of the disclosure.

Neither Party shall issue any news release, public announcement, advertisement or any other form of publicity concerning the content or subject matter of this agreement, unless prior written intimation is given to the other Party prior to release.
Registered Merchant may create campaigns, subject to Bank’s prior written approval, to increase the usage of the Cards.

Registered Merchant represents and warrants that it is a legal entity having the power and authority to validly execute this Agreement, to perform its obligations hereunder and to complete the transactions contemplated herein. The execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action on the part of Registered Merchant. This Agreement has been duly executed and delivered by Registered Merchant or its duly authorized representative and constitutes the legal, valid and binding obligations of such party, enforceable in accordance with the terms herein.

Unregistered Merchant represents and warrants that: (1) he/she is of legal age and has the power and authority to validly execute this Agreement, to perform its obligations hereunder and to complete the transactions contemplated herein; (2) he/she is not required by the law to be registered with DTI, SEC or other government regulatory bodies; (3) execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement will not result in any violation of law, ordinance, regulation, permit, rule or license; and (3) he/she is not involved or has been involved in any investigation due to fraud, scam or other bogus transactions.
Unregistered Merchant undertakes to register its business if required by the law or applicable rules or regulations and to promptly notify the Bank of such requirement and registration.
The Bank and Registered Merchant represent and warrant that the execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement by will not result in: -

any conflict with their respective articles of association, certificate of incorporation, by-laws or equivalent organizational document; or any breach or violation of, default under any statute, law, regulation, ordinance, rule, permit, concession, grant, franchise, license or other governmental authorization or approval, judgment, order, decree or any mortgage, agreement, deed of trust, indenture or any other instrument to which the Bank and/or Registered Merchant is a party or by which the Bank and/or Registered

Merchant or any of their properties or assets are bound or which is otherwise applicable to them subject to such permissions and authorizations as may be required from regulatory authorities, credit card / charge card network organizations.

there are no judicial or administrative actions, proceedings or investigations pending or to the best knowledge of the Bank and/or Registered Merchant which threatens the validity, implementation or enforcement of this Agreement or any action taken or to be taken by Bank and/or Registered Merchant that is material to the transactions contemplated by this Agreement.

It shall comply with the provisions of the Anti-Graft and Corrupt Practices Act, the Code of Conduct for Government Officials and all other applicable anti-bribery laws, the Consumer Act of the Philippines and its Implementing Rules and Regulations, and Anti Money Laundering Act (AMLA), and all other laws, government rules and regulations applicable to Merchant; and
It shall implement a risk management infrastructure which includes internal fraud avoidance files, updated transaction controls and adaptive fraud detection tools.

Merchant shall provide access to parties nominated by the Bank and the banking authorities to the System, operation, documentation and facilities to carry out review or assessment for regulatory, audit or compliance purposes. Bank shall notify Merchant in writing of any such audit, review or assessment at least fifteen (15) days before they are conducted. Unless the context otherwise required, any such audit, review or assessment shall be conducted during Merchant’s normal business hours and shall not interfere unreasonably with Merchant’ business activities.

Unless otherwise provided in this Agreement, neither Party shall be liable for any indirect, punitive, special, incidental or consequential loss or damage in connection with or arising out of this Agreement (including loss of profits, savings, use or any other economic advantage) arising in respect of any breach of term or condition or liability in contract, tort or otherwise, whether or not such party has been advised of the possibility of such loss.

Merchant agrees that the Bank will not be liable to Merchant’s clients, customers, and/or employees or any third party for any modification, suspension, or discontinuance of operation of the Software or the Service, or any part thereof, due to Merchant’s negligence, acts, or omissions, or those of third persons.

THE BANK MAKES NO WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, REGARDING THE SERVICES OR SOFTWARE USED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE SERVICES, AND ALL SUCH WARRANTIES, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT ARE HEREBY EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMED BY THE BANK. Merchant acknowledges that the Bank has not represented or warranted that the Services will be uninterrupted, error free or without delay. Merchant may not rely upon any representation or warranty regarding the Services or Software by any third party, including, without limitation, representations or warranties by an ISP.

The Bank is not responsible for the operation or security of the Merchant Website, the websites hosted by Merchant, ISPs, the availability or performance of the internet, Merchant or Merchant’s customer’s connection to the internet or the actions or inaction of any other third party.

The Bank does not guarantee the security of the Services and will not be responsible for any infiltration of its security systems, provided that the Bank has used commercially reasonable efforts to prevent any such infiltration.

The Bank will, in providing the UnionBank Payment Gateway Service, rely upon information, instructions, and services from the Merchant, its employees, and agents and financial and credit institutions, and other third parties. Merchant fully assumes the risk associated with errors in such information, instructions and services provided that the Bank has accurately transmitted the data and/or complied with authorized instructions.

IN NO EVENT WILL THE BANK’S TOTAL LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT EXCEED THE LESSER OF THE FEES PAID TO THE BANK BY MERCHANT UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WITHIN THE 12 MONTH PERIOD PRIOR TO THE EVENT WHICH GAVE RISE TO THE CLAIM FOR DAMAGES OR PHP 20,000 FOR REGISTERED MERCHANT AND PHP 10,000

FOR UNREGISTERED MERCHANT. IN NO EVENT WILL THE BANK OR ITS LICENSORS HAVE ANY LIABILITY TO MASTER MERCHANT OR ANY OTHER PARTY FOR ANY LOST OPPORTUNITY OR PROFITS, COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES, OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, PUNITIVE OR SPECIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT, UNDER ANY CAUSE OF ACTION OR THEORY OF LIABILITY (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), AND WHETHER OR NOT THE BANK HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS WILL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY LIMITED REMEDY.

Merchant shall indemnify and hold the Bank, its directors, officers, employees and agents harmless from and against, and defend any claim, suit or proceeding and pay any settlement amounts or damages awarded by a court of final jurisdiction arising out of claims (i) resulting from the willful acts, omissions or negligence of Merchant, its employees or agents; (ii) relating to any claims filed in respect of infringement of a third party right in connection with the Software and/or Service; and (iii) resulting from non-compliance with PCI-DSS and Cards brand ruling, or (iv) resulting from non-compliance with its undertakings in this Agreement.

The Bank will be entitled to have full conduct of all proceedings and negotiations relating to any such claim and in its discretion to accept, dispute, compromise, or otherwise deal with the same and shall be under no liability in respect thereof to the merchant and the Merchant shall provide any and all assistance in connection with such claim that the Bank may require.

Neither Party shall assign or otherwise transfer any of its rights and obligations under this Agreement, wholly or in part without the prior written consent of the other Party which shall not be unreasonably withheld. The rights and obligations of the Parties hereunder will be binding upon and inure to the Parties permitted successors and permitted assigns.

Neither Party shall be liable for any failure to perform its obligations under this Agreement if the failure results from events beyond the reasonable control of either Party. For the purposes of this Agreement such events shall include, but not limited to, strikes or other labor disputes, riots, civil disturbances, any revision in government regulation or statutory limitation, external telecommunications failures or outages, acts of God, war, fire, explosion, earthquake, flood or other catastrophes.
\n\nIn case of such events, the time for performance required by either party under this Agreement shall be suspended for any period during which the performance is prevented by the event

In the event that the Merchant has concerns regarding the payment gateway and its usage, the Merchant may contact UnionBank’s Customer Corporate Care by phone: (02) 667-2668 or by Email: union3c@unionbankph.com, Monday-Friday 8:30-5:30 (except holidays).

The Parties are independent contractors. No agency, partnership, joint-venture or formal business organization of any kind is created by this Agreement and neither Party shall have the right to bind the other, or represent to any person that it has the right to do so. Merchant shall conduct its activities under this Agreement as its own principal and not as agent of the Bank.

No waiver of any breach of this Agreement shall be deemed to be a waiver of any other or of any subsequent breach. The failure of either Party to enforce at any time any of the provisions of this Agreement shall in no way be interpreted as a waiver of such provision.

Unless otherwise provided in this Agreement, all remedies shall be cumulative and in addition to and not in lieu of any other remedies to either Party at law, in equity, or otherwise. Furthermore, there shall be no obligation upon either Party to exercise a specific remedy.

The provisions of this Agreement shall always prevail over any inconsistent terms or conditions embodied within any purchase order, invoice or other documentation issued under or in connection with this Agreement.

If any provision herein is deemed by any tribunal or court of competent jurisdiction to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable under any applicable law or otherwise, it shall, to the extent required by such law, be severed from this Agreement and rendered ineffective so far as is possible without affecting the legality, validity or enforceability of the remaining provisions hereto.

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Philippines without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any dispute whatsoever arising between the Parties concerning the interpretation or implementation of this Agreement or touching any subject matter arising or in relation to the Agreement shall in the first instance be referred to the duly authorized senior executives of the Bank and the Merchant, respectively, for amicable resolution. Any dispute or controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this contract, or the breach, termination or invalidity thereof shall be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Philippine Dispute Resolution Center Inc., Arbitration Rules as at present in force. The number of arbitrators shall be three (3). The place of arbitration shall be Pasig City. Any award or decision by the arbitral body may be enforced by the Parties in the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Pasig City to the exclusion of all other courts.
Merchant’s application is subject to Bank’s approval.

The Merchant hereby engages the Bank as its service provider to provide online payment gateway services, specifically the Unionbank Payment Gateway Service, which allows Customers to pay and Merchant to receive payments through a wide array of payment facilities.

Merchant desires to use Unionbank Payment Gateway Service to receive payment of goods and/or services from Customers through available channels including but not limited to Cards, bank transfers (through PESONet or Instapay), GCash, Over The Counter, Digital Wallet, Partner Channels and QR code (“Service”).

By availing the Service, the Merchant is granted a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, non-sublicensable license by the Bank to use and access Unionbank Payment Gateway Service subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement and other agreements executed by the Parties.
